promptStages: Stage 2: Image Analysis (type, key information, classification impact)

thesis.coreQuestion: How can humanoid robots maintain stable locomotion when motor thermal limits or actuator failures occur?
thesis.coreArgument: By combining physics-based thermal modeling with learned failure estimation networks, robots can predict and adapt to motor degradation in real-time
thesis.coreEvidence: Two-resistor thermal model with online learning achieves accurate temperature prediction; FEMNet enables fault-aware policy adaptation

semanticUnits.content: Thermal Control of Electrical Motors for High-Power Humanoid Robots

details.problem: Electric motors in humanoid robots face thermal limits that restrict maximum performance
details.solution: Water cooling system proposed for stable long-term motor operation
details.evidence: Blue dashed line in graph shows modified motor with extended operational time

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Time vs Max Motor Current Rational showing three motor configurations: EC16 40W 32V (green), ECpowermax30 200W 48V (black solid), ECpowermax30 200W 48V with water-cooling (blue dashed)
imageAnalysis.classificationImpact: Demonstrates quantitative benefit of cooling - supports Methods/Hardware section

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be classified as Results if graph shows experimental data rather than spec sheet
selfCritique.finalDecision: Introduction/Problem is appropriate as it establishes the motivation and context

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Directly addresses core question by showing thermal limits constrain motor performance

semanticUnits.content: Two-resistor thermal model for calculating winding and core temperatures from sensor data

details.approach: Physics-based thermal modeling using equivalent circuit representation
details.components: P (power input), T1/T2 (temperatures), R1/R2 (thermal resistances), C1/C2 (thermal capacitances), Ta (ambient)
details.purpose: To estimate internal motor temperatures that cannot be directly measured

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Two-stage RC thermal network: Power input P -> R1-C1 stage (winding) -> R2-C2 stage (housing) -> Ambient Ta
imageAnalysis.classificationImpact: Core methodology figure - essential for Methods section

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be Background/Related Work if this is a standard model from literature
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Modeling is correct as the paper adapts and extends this model

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Physics-based foundation that the learned parameters augment

semanticUnits.content: Optimization using MSE between measured housing temperature and 2-resistor model prediction

details.constraints: Log-scale learning to ensure R1, R2, C1, C2, and other parameters remain positive

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Parameter symbols indicating thermal resistances and capacitances being optimized

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be Implementation Details rather than core Methods
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Optimization captures the algorithmic contribution accurately

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Online learning mechanism for adapting thermal model - key to real-time adaptation claim

semanticUnits.content: FEMNet (Failure Estimation Model Network) architecture for fault detection and adaptation

details.modulationModel: 64x64 network computing gamma_1, gamma_2 parameters for context modulation z_tilde = gamma_1 * z_t + gamma_2

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Two-part architecture: (a) Failure estimation model with encoder producing v_t, f_t, z_t; (b) Modulation model transforming context vector
imageAnalysis.classificationImpact: Core contribution figure - central to Methods section

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: None - this is clearly the main methodological contribution
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Architecture is the only appropriate classification

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: The learned failure estimation network that enables fault-aware adaptation

semanticUnits.content: Data collection strategy using 12 actuator damage scenarios

details.scenarios: tau^i represents i-th actuator damaged scenario (i=0,1,...,11)
details.trajectories: traj^i_n is n-th trajectory in i-th scenario, N=20000 trajectories per scenario
details.dataFormat: Each trajectory contains (s, d, state-action pairs) tuples

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Set notation defining trajectory collection T = {T^i}_{i=0,1,...,11} with each T^i containing N trajectories

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be Experimental Setup rather than Methods
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/DataCollection is appropriate as it describes the training data generation methodology

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Simulation-based data generation enables learning without real hardware damage

semanticUnits.content: Bio-inspired concept: Animals continue locomotion with injured limbs

details.observation: Injured animals adapt gait to compensate for damaged limbs
details.robotProblem: ToddlerBot falls after 19 minutes due to servo motor overload causing torque reduction
details.researchQuestion: How to operate longer without functional failure? How to respond to accumulated risk?

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Hedgehog with bandaged/cast leg - visual metaphor for injured-but-mobile creature

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be excluded as non-technical content
selfCritique.finalDecision: Include as Motivation - provides important research context and intuition

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Biological inspiration for fault-tolerant locomotion research

semanticUnits.content: Motor heat generation model: P_loss = P_el - P_mech

details.heatSource: Difference between electrical input power and mechanical output power
details.dominantLoss: Winding copper losses (I^2R) are the primary heat source
details.simulation: MuJoCo provides torque and velocity for heat calculation

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: P_loss = P_el - P_mech = (tau*omega)/eta - tau*omega, showing heat as efficiency loss

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Background/Theory if this is well-established physics
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Physics as it is applied specifically to the simulation context

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Physical grounding for heat prediction in simulation

semanticUnits.content: Input and output power equations for motor thermal analysis

details.mechanicalPower: P_mech = tau * omega (torque times angular velocity)
details.application: Foundation for calculating heat generation in simulation

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: P_mech = tau * omega - basic mechanical power formula

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be merged with SU-007 as single unit
selfCritique.finalDecision: Keep separate for atomic documentation of each formula

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Building block for thermal simulation

semanticUnits.content: Torque derating due to motor overheating - KOLLMORGEN reference

details.phenomenon: Motor temperature rise causes maximum torque reduction
details.industryPractice: Manufacturers specify derating curves for thermal limits
details.implication: Robots must account for reduced capability at high temperatures

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: alpha_i(T_i) piecewise function: 1 when T<T_th, linear reduction between T_th and T_max, 0 when T>=T_max; tau_out = alpha_i(T_i) * tau_cmd
imageAnalysis.classificationImpact: Key equation for thermal-aware torque limiting

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Methods/Control if this is the proposed controller
selfCritique.finalDecision: Background/Problem as it describes the phenomenon to be addressed

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Formal model of the thermal constraint the system must handle

semanticUnits.content: Thermal Controller: Motor core temperature control objective

details.controlObjective: Regulate motor core temperature by limiting torque commands
details.lossFunction: L_control = MSE(c1_predicted, c1_max) + W_control * MSE(0, f_limit)

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Loss function combining temperature tracking (c1 vs c1_max) and fault vector regularization

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be Optimization/Training rather than Control
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Control is appropriate as it defines the control objective

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Directly implements thermal-aware control for safe operation

semanticUnits.content: Proposed thermal model with learnable parameters P1-P5

details.extension: Augments standard 2-resistor model with 5 learnable correction terms

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Modified heat equations (7') and (8') with exponential parameterization of thermal resistances
imageAnalysis.classificationImpact: Core methodological contribution for thermal modeling

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: None - this is clearly the proposed model extension
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Modeling captures the novel contribution

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Learnable physics model combining domain knowledge with data-driven adaptation

semanticUnits.content: Online learning parameters for thermal model

details.updateRule: Gradient descent on thermal parameters P_{1,2,3,4,5}

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Parameter update rule: P_{1,2,3,4,5} <- P_{1,2,3,4,5} - alpha * dL_update/dP_{1,2,3,4,5}

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Implementation Details rather than Methods
selfCritique.finalDecision: Methods/Training as these are key algorithmic choices

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Online learning enables real-time model adaptation

semanticUnits.content: HeatState simulation results showing torque and temperature profiles

details.visualization: Time-series plots of actuator torque (st_torque) and target torque (target_tau)
details.range: Torque values between -2.0 and 1.0 Nm over 100+ seconds

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: Two plots showing torque oscillations characteristic of walking gait; high-frequency variations indicate rapid control adjustments

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Could be Experimental Setup showing test conditions
selfCritique.finalDecision: Results/HeatState as slide title explicitly indicates results

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Empirical validation of thermal-aware control in simulation

semanticUnits.content: Limitations of 2-axis thermal model measurement results

details.finding: Simplified model shows limitations in certain operating conditions
details.robot: ToddlerBot humanoid platform used for validation

imageAnalysis.keyInfo: ToddlerBot CAD model showing actuator locations; accompanying graph shows model prediction errors

selfCritique.alternativeClassification: Discussion section rather than Results
selfCritique.finalDecision: Results/Limitations is appropriate as it presents empirical findings

semanticUnits.thesisConnection: Honest assessment of current model limitations - motivates future work

semanticUnits.content: ToddlerBot module path resolution fix using pathlib

details.problem: os.path relative paths not working correctly
details.solution: Use pathlib for absolute path resolution

selfCritique.finalDecision: Include as Implementation/Software for reproducibility

semanticUnits.content: DreamFLEX: Fault-aware quadrupedal locomotion on rough terrain

faultTypes.lockedJoint: External impact causing joint fixation or range limitation
faultTypes.weakenedMotor: Overheating or power shortage limiting torque output

details.approach: Learn to minimize sim2real gap for fault conditions

selfCritique.finalDecision: RelatedWork as it cites specific prior work
